meta.title: Systems & Process
meta.subtitle: I design delivery workflows that reduce ambiguity and improve reliability — from requirements → execution → release → support.

items.title: Clarity before code
items.body: I translate goals into scoped requirements and decision points so teams build the right thing with less rework.

items.title: Ownership end-to-end
items.body: I take responsibility beyond implementation — including production behavior, iteration, and stakeholder clarity.

items.title: Maintainability
items.body: I build systems and patterns that others can understand, extend, and operate confidently.

steps.title: 1) Requirements & alignment
bullets: Clarify goals, constraints, and what “done” means
Capture scope in a lightweight PRD or spec
Identify risks early (timeline, dependencies, content, infra)

steps.title: 2) Plan the system
bullets: Break work into modules and interfaces
Define data flows and content models
Choose the simplest architecture that scales

steps.title: 3) Build with structure
bullets: Small, reviewable increments to keep velocity stable

steps.title: 5) Support & iteration
bullets: Fix issues quickly and reduce recurring problems
Improve workflows and docs as the system evolves
Treat maintenance as part of delivery, not an afterthought

tooling.title: Tooling & habits that keep work reliable

items.title: Documentation that reduces chaos
items.body: Specs, decisions, and handover notes that make work easy to resume and easy to share.

items.title: Quality checks
items.body: Lint/type safety, quick smoke tests, and reviewable PRs to keep production stable.

items.title: Stakeholder communication
items.body: Frequent checkpoints, clear timelines, and transparent tradeoffs to prevent surprises.

cta.title: Want to work together?
cta.body: If you need a reliable developer who can own delivery and reduce ambiguity, let’s talk.
